speaker: Training Chamber
lines: Circles are chalked on stone; some are arguments, some are apologies.
Targets float just high enough to annoy.
A practice ward hums and occasionally says 'no' out loud.
Scorch marks overlap into maps of optimism.
Books sit open to diagrams that will forgive your handwriting later.
A tutor claps once; the room arranges itself into attention.
"Power. Knowledge. Balance." the tutor intones, and the chalk nods.
Choose a discipline today. Tomorrow you can choose again if you remember these answers.

give_item.name: Ward
give_item.description: Interpose intention between harm and home
